resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: [C++] Do not set -Werror when using BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL=CHECKIN in release mode

pitrou commented on issue #3599: ARROW-4520: [C++] use voidified expr to ignore DCHECK() custom messages in NDEBUG
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3599#issuecomment-462426797
 
 
   How about the following:
   ```cpp
   
   #define DCHECK(condition)       \
     ARROW_IGNORE_EXPR(condition); \
     ARROW_CHECK(true)
   
   #define DCHECK_EQ(val1, val2) \
     ARROW_IGNORE_EXPR(val1);    \
     ARROW_IGNORE_EXPR(val2);    \
     ARROW_CHECK(true)
   
   // [etc.]
   ```
   
   Hopefully that can please all compilers.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] DCHECK custom messages are unreachable in release

comments.body: After https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3854 clang is complaining that custom messages are unreachable again; arguments to the `DCHECK` macros need to be explicitly ignored and the NullLog needs to be voidified

This issue only arises with {{-DBUILD_WARNING_LEVEL=CHECKIN}} which enables a bunch of warnings in addition to {{-Werror}}. We have not strived for a warning-free build in release mode so I think we should close this and perhaps raise a CMake error if the user tries to use Release and CHECKIN together
I'll submit a PR to improve the developer documentation about this
